qas.question: When was he appointed Patriarch of Venice?
Pope Pius XII raised him to what rank?
When did he leave France for Venice?
When did he take up his new diocese in Venice?
Who was the President of France in 1953?
When was Pope Pius XII appointed Patriarch of Venice?

plausible_answers.text: the rank of Cardinal-Priest of Santa Prisca

qas.question: What rank was Pope Pius XII raised to?
On what date did Pope Pius XII leave France to go to Venice?
When did Pope Pius XII take possession of the diocese in Venice?
What did the President of France give to Pope Piux XII as a sign of esteem?

context: <b5_0>On <a0_0>12 January 1953<b5_0/><a0_0/>, he was appointed Patriarch of Venice and, accordingly, raised to <b6_0>the rank of <a1_0>Cardinal-Priest of Santa Prisca<b6_0/><a1_0/> by Pope Pius XII. Roncalli left France for Venice <b7_0>on <a2_0>23 February 1953<b7_0/><a2_0/> stopping briefly in Milan and then to Rome. <b8_0>On <a3_0>15 March 1953<b8_0/><a3_0/>, he took possession of his new diocese in Venice. As a sign of his esteem, the President of France, <a4_0>Vincent Auriol<a4_0/>, claimed the ancient privilege possessed by French monarchs and bestowed <b9_0>the red biretta<b9_0/> on Roncalli at a ceremony in the Élysée Palace. It was around this time that he, with the aid of Monsignor Bruno Heim, formed his coat of arms with a lion of Saint Mark on a white ground. Auriol also awarded Roncalli three months later with the award of Commander of the Legion of Honour.
